1. Netmask in /k notation.
2. Wildcard is the "leftover 0s" turned to 1's
3. Network address = IP Address ANDed with Netmask
4. Range = (Network Address+1) + (wildcard-1); iff all 1's
         = (Network Address+1) + wildcard; else


A) IP Address: 10.0.130.0/23
00001010.00000000.10000010.00000000

Netmask: 255.255.254.0 = 23
11111111.11111111.11111110.00000000

Wildcard: 0.0.1.255
00000000.00000000.00000001.11111111

Network Addres: 00001010.00000000.10000010.00000000 (10.0.130.0/23)

Range: 130.1/23 - 131.254


B) IP Address: 10.0.132.0/22
00001010.00000000.10000100.00000000

Netmask: 255.255.252.0
11111111.11111111.11111100.00000000

Wildcard: 0.0.3.255

Network Addres: 00001010.00000000.10000100.00000000 (10.0.131.0/22)

Range: 132.1 - 135.254


C) IP Address: 10.0.64.0/18 *Remeber the -1 for powers of 2*
00001010.00000000.10000000.00000000

Netmask: 255.255.192.0
11111111.11111111.11000000.00000000

Wildcard: 0.0.63.255

Network Addres: 00001010.00000000.10000000.00000000 (10.0.64.0/18)

Range: 64.1 - 127.254


D) IP Address: 10.0.180.0/21
00001010.00000000.10110100.00000000

Netmask: 255.255.248.0
11111111.11111111.11111000.00000000

Wildcard: 0.0.7.255

Network Addres: 00001010.00000000.10110000.00000000 (10.0.176.0/21)

Range: 176.1 - 183.254


E) IP Address: 10.0.0.64/26
00001010.00000000.00000000.10000000

Netmask: 255.255.255.192
11111111.11111111.11111111.11000000

Wildcard: 0.0.0.63

Network Address: 00001010.00000000.00000000.10000000 (10.0.0.64/26)

Range: 0.65 - 0.127
